makeover.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if you give someone a makeover, you make them look more attractive by giving them new clothes, a new hairstyle etc
makeover.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if you give a place a makeover, you make it look more attractive by painting the walls, putting in new furniture etc
makeover.translation[0].definitions[1].e: It’s time we gave the kitchen a makeover.
makeover.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a process of making big changes to a product or company to improve its image and encourage more people to buy the product or invest in the company
makeover.translation[1].definitions[0].e: As part of a makeover this year, the company appointed a new chairman.
Analysts have pointed to the sliding sales of the brand and say it needs a completemarketing makeover.
